Notice. A Farm and Salt Meadow for Sale

Object Name
Text
Title
Notice. A Farm and Salt Meadow for Sale
Date
1809-01-10
Author
Holmes, William
Publisher
Centinel of Freedom
Place of publication
Newark, New Jersey
Holding institution
Readex All Search
Source
infoweb.newsbank.com
Copyright
No known copyright restrictions.
Notes
A Farm and Salt Meadow. FOR SALE. The former situate about one mile above the bdirge at Belleville, adjoining the farm of Mr. Gerard Rutgers, containing thirty seven acres, seven of which is very thrifty Wood land. It is divided into small fields, with good durable fences; about ten acres is laid down in Timothy Meadow, and the whole of the land is of an excellent quality with an apple orchard and a great abundance of peach and cherry trees...Also one hundred acres of SALT MEADOW, lying on the rear of the house built at the junction of the Belleville and Newark roads, and joining on the cedar-swamp road and Hackensack River; it will be sold very low altogether; the purchaser may have benefit of the present crop, if applied for soon. Also for sale about fifty stacks of SALT HAY, standing on the above meadow; the hay is of an excellent quality and put up without rain. For terms apply to the subscriber, WILLIAM HOLMES. N.B. Attendance on the meadows will be given three successive Saturdays, at about 12 o'clock. Belleville, Oct. 24, 1808. 30.
